news.title: Uber and Lyft Shutdown in California Averted as Judge Grants Emergency Stay
news.description: A California appeals court has temporarily blocked an order that would require Lyft and Uber to classify its drivers as employees, stopping both entities from ceasing California operations.

news.title: Secret Service Buys Location Data That Would Otherwise Need a Warrant
news.description: Law enforcement agencies including the Secret Service are reportedly purchasing cell phone location data gathered by private companies and data brokers rather than seeking warrants.

news.title: Federal Appeals Court Says Amazon is Liable for Third-Party Sellers’ Products
news.description: Third-party vendors are the source of more than half of Amazon’s e-commerce revenue, and in previous cases courts have declined to hold Amazon liable for those parties’ products.

news.title: Epic Games’ Lawsuits Fire a Shot at Apple and Google’s App Store ‘Monopolies’
news.description: The game developer is alleging that Apple and Google have engaged in anti-competitive conduct following their removal of Fortnite and its in-app payment system from app stores.
